{{Infobox OS | name = Buildix | screenshot = [[Image:Buildix.png|250px]] | caption = Buildix 1.1 | developer = [[ThoughtWorks]] | family = [[Linux]] | source_model = [[Open source]] | working_state = Current | kernel_type = [[Monolithic kernel]] | license = Various | website = [http://buildix.thoughtworks.com buildix.thoughtworks.com] }} '''Buildix''' is an [[operating system]] which can be used as a [[Live CD]]. It is an [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]]-based [[Linux distribution]], developed by Global IT professional services firm, [[ThoughtWorks]].
Buildix is aimed at helping [[Agile software development|agile]] developers to get their projects up and running quickly and easily. The bundled software includes the key ingredients for an [[agile software development]] project including: [[CruiseControl]] (a [[continuous integration]] server), [[Subversion (software)|Subversion]] (a [[revision control]] system), [[Trac]] (a project-management tool) and [[Mingle]] (a commercial tool that aids agile management).
==Contents== Buildix is intended to run as a server and so the package list is initially quite small. There is no [[X window manager|window manager]] installed which means that buildix has very modest hardware requirements. The most significant packages include: *[[CruiseControl]] *[[Subversion (software)|Subversion]] *[[Trac]] *[[Apache Ant]] *[[Apache Tomcat]] *[[Apache HTTP Server]]
==History== Active development on Buildix has stopped, and will probably not resume <ref>[http://blog.chris-read.net/2009/12/16/the-end-of-buildix/ The End of Buildix]</ref>.
Last version, v2.1 released on 2008-05-02 <ref>[http://buildix.thoughtworks.com/index.php/download/ Last version of Buildix]</ref>.
